ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:0.5_0: The training rule on covering with rice
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their curries with rice because they wanted more. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not cover my curries with rice because I want more,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.4_0: he should not cover the various kinds of curry with rice because he wants more;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his curries with rice because he wants more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.10_0: if the owners cover it and then give;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.11_0: if it is not out of a desire for more;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.15_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
